info.description:
3M Platform API - A comprehensive platform for user interactions, messaging, financial management, and profile management.

## Overview

This API provides a complete solution for the 3M Platform, featuring user authentication, profile management, real-time messaging, financial transactions, and support systems. All endpoints use Laravel Sanctum for authentication with Bearer tokens.

## Latest Updates (October 17, 2025)

**Budget Upgrade Feature:**
- Added budget upgrade pricing calculation endpoint
- Added budget upgrade payment submission endpoint
- Enhanced insufficient budget flow for users with active subscriptions
- Added detailed pricing breakdown for budget upgrades
- Enhanced chat endpoints with message visibility based on budget and subscription status

## Key Features

- **User Management**: Complete profile and financial profile management
- **Real-time Communication**: Chat system with AI moderation, file attachments, and budget-based message visibility
- **Financial Services**: Wallet management, transactions, subscription plans, and budget upgrade functionality
- **Social Features**: User interactions, blocking, and reporting systems
- **Support System**: Ticket management with file attachments and spam protection
- **Search & Discovery**: Advanced user search with filtering and pagination
- **Options API**: Static configuration options and predefined values for UI components

## Authentication

Most endpoints require Bearer token authentication:
```
Authorization: Bearer {your_token}
```

## Rate Limiting

- Chat: 60 requests/minute (30 for sending messages)
- Support: 10 requests/day per IP
- General: Varies by endpoint

For detailed information about specific API sections, please refer to the individual tag descriptions below.
info.title: 3M Api

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: Endpoints related to user authentication, including login, logout, token management, and API key validation. These routes are used to verify user credentials, establish secure access to the API, and handle user session termination with optional OneSignal subscription cleanup.

tags.name: Profile
tags.description: Endpoints for viewing, updating, and managing the authenticated user's profile information, such as personal details, preferences, photos, and account settings. Includes comprehensive Profile Images and Albums API for organizing user photos into different categories like personal photos, places visited, interests, and fashion choices.

tags.name: Financial Profile
tags.description: Endpoints for managing user financial profile information including budget, capital level, income, milestone settings, and financial options. All endpoints require Bearer token authentication.

tags.name: Currencies
tags.description: Get all the available currencies data

tags.name: Chat
tags.description: The Chat API provides comprehensive messaging functionality for the platform, including direct messaging, message management, and chat room operations. All endpoints require authentication and integrate with RocketChat for real-time messaging. Features include AI-powered content moderation with strike system, file attachments, real-time events, chat archiving, message search, and rate limiting. The API supports both text messages and file attachments, with automatic content moderation that can disable chat between users based on violation strikes.

tags.name: Reports & Interactions
tags.description: Endpoints for user interactions including profile management (archive, save, interest), user blocking, zoom call requests, and user reporting. All endpoints require Bearer token authentication.

tags.name: Contracts
tags.description: Endpoints for managing contracts between sponsors and seekers, including contract creation, approval, modification, and lifecycle management.

tags.name: People
tags.description: The People API provides endpoints for viewing public user profiles and their information. These endpoints allow authenticated users to view other users' profiles using their public username. All endpoints require Bearer token authentication and return comprehensive profile data including personal information, relationship preferences, financial details, living arrangements, and profile images. The API also includes a public endpoint for retrieving age ranges used in profile display and search functionality.

tags.name: Support Tickets
tags.description: Endpoints for managing support tickets, including creating, viewing, updating tickets, retrieving categories, statuses, and notification options, and managing ticket messages with file attachments. Supports both authenticated users and guest access with pagination. File attachments support PDF, JPG, JPEG, PNG (max 15MB each). Rate limited: 10 requests per day per IP, 20 requests per day per IP network. All endpoints use optional authentication middleware, working with Bearer tokens or X-Guest-Email headers. Includes spam protection, file validation, and comprehensive ticket lifecycle management.

tags.name: Notifications
tags.description:
The Notifications API provides comprehensive endpoints for managing user notifications, including listing, filtering, marking as read, updating importance, and managing user preferences. All endpoints require Bearer token authentication.

## Features

- **Filtering & Pagination**: Filter by importance (low/medium/high), categories, and read status with pagination support
- **Read Management**: Mark individual or all notifications as read
- **Importance Control**: Update notification importance (except for Notice category)
- **User Preferences**: Manage notification delivery preferences (email/push) and content type
- **Real-time Count**: Get unread notification count for badges
- **Styling Support**: Pre-calculated CSS classes and hex colors for consistent UI rendering
- **Link Extraction**: Automatic extraction of URLs from message content (domain removed, path only)

## Notification Types

### Profile Notifications
- **Category**: `Profile` | **Group**: `Profile` | **Importance**: medium (default, changeable)
- Sent when someone marks a user as interested
- Includes interested user details (ID, name, avatar)
- **Styling**: Icon bg-pink-400 (#F472B6), Category bg-pink-100 text-pink-700

### Notice Notifications
- **Category**: `Notice` | **Group**: `Notice` | **Importance**: Set by admin (unchangeable)
- System-generated notifications with HTML content support
- Automatically extracts links from message content into `links_in_message` array
- **Styling**: Icon bg-blue-400 (#60A5FA), Category bg-blue-100 text-blue-700
- **Note**: Importance cannot be changed by users

### Balance Notifications
- **Categories**: `BalanceIncrease`, `BalanceDecrease` | **Group**: `Balance` | **Importance**: low (default, changeable)
- Sent for wallet transactions and balance changes
- Includes transaction details (ID, amount, currency)
- **Styling**: Icon bg-green-400 (#4ADE80), Category bg-green-100 text-green-700

### Contract Notifications
- **Categories**: `ContractOfferReceived`, `ContractOfferSent`, `ContractStopped`, `ContractApproved`, `ContractRestarted`, `ContractPausedReminder`, `ContractRejected`, `ContractChangeRequested`
- **Group**: `Contract` | **Importance**: medium (default, changeable)
- **Styling**: Icon bg-purple-400 (#A78BFA), Category bg-purple-100 text-purple-700

### Chat Notifications
- **Category**: `Chat` | **Importance**: medium (default, changeable)
- Sent for chat-related activities

## Implementation Notes

1. **Filtering**: Use query parameters to filter by importance, categories (comma-separated), and read status
2. **Pagination**: All list endpoints support `per_page` and `page` parameters (default: 15/page)
3. **Importance Updates**: Only non-Notice notifications can have their importance changed
4. **Preferences**: Automatically created with defaults if they don't exist
5. **Styling**: Each notification includes CSS classes and hex colors for consistent UI rendering
6. **Link Extraction**: The `links_in_message` field extracts all HTML anchor tag URLs, removes domains, and keeps only paths for easy in-app navigation
7. **Timezone Support**: Timestamps provided in both UTC and user's local timezone with formatted versions

## Mobile App Integration

### Recommended Flow
1. **App Launch**: GET `/unread-count` for badge
2. **Notifications Screen**: GET `/filter` for options, then GET `/` with filters
3. **Notification Tap**: GET `/{id}` for details, then POST `/{id}/mark-read`
4. **Settings**: Use `/preferences` endpoints
5. **Background Sync**: Periodically call `/unread-count`

### Link Navigation
Use the `links_in_message` array to navigate to links extracted from notification messages:
```javascript
if (notification.links_in_message.length > 0) {
  const path = notification.links_in_message[0];
  router.push(path); // Navigate to /profile/edit, /settings, etc.
}
```

tags.name: Affiliate
tags.description: Endpoints for managing affiliate links, statistics, and earnings. All endpoints require Bearer token authentication using Laravel Sanctum.

tags.name: Wallet
tags.description: Endpoints for managing user wallet and balance information, including retrieving current balance, deposits, withdrawals, and purchase power. All endpoints require Bearer token authentication.

tags.name: Search
tags.description: Endpoints for searching user profiles with advanced filtering options including location, budget, languages, and custom parameters. Features automatic role-based filtering (sponsors see seekers, seekers see sponsors), mutual interest visibility, location-based search using Haversine formula, currency conversion for budget comparisons, and comprehensive custom parameter filtering across general info, relationship preferences, financial details, and living preferences. Supports pagination, sorting by budget/age/created date, and subscription-based filtering. All endpoints require Bearer token authentication.

tags.name: Subscription
tags.description: Endpoints for managing user subscriptions, including viewing current subscription, available plans, submitting subscriptions, and managing budget upgrades. All endpoints require Bearer token authentication using Laravel Sanctum.

tags.name: Transactions
tags.description: Endpoints for managing user transactions, including viewing transaction history, details, status, and cancellation. All endpoints require Bearer token authentication using Laravel Sanctum. Supports filtering by status and type, with comprehensive transaction data including payments, subscription plans, and counterparty information. Features include status styling with CSS classes and color codes, pagination, and detailed transaction relationships.

tags.name: Options
tags.description: Endpoints for retrieving static configuration options and predefined values used throughout the 3M Matching Platform. These endpoints return static data that clients can use to populate dropdown menus, form fields, and other UI components. All options endpoints are public and do not require authentication.

tags.name: Account Management
tags.description: Endpoints for managing user account settings including username, password, and email updates. All endpoints require authentication using Laravel Sanctum Bearer tokens. Features include validation, activity logging, and security measures for account modifications.

tags.name: OneSignal
tags.description: Endpoints for managing OneSignal push notification subscriptions and player IDs. Handles device registration, subscription management, and logout cleanup for push notifications. All endpoints require Bearer token authentication using Laravel Sanctum.

post.description:
Registration API with two-step process for user account creation.

## Step 1: Initial Validation
Validates user credentials and performs reCAPTCHA verification. Returns a session ID for Step 2.

## Step 2: Complete Registration
Completes user registration with additional profile information and creates the user account.

### Key Features:
- Two-step registration process with reCAPTCHA verification
- Mobile registration support (skips reCAPTCHA when is_mobile=Y)
- Comprehensive validation for all fields
- Automatic profile creation (financial, relationship, visibility settings)
- Affiliate/referral system support
- Timezone handling with offset or timezone identifier
- Budget conversion to system default currency
- RocketChat integration
- Email verification and welcome notifications
- Test user detection (login_name starting with 'test_')

### Validation Rules:
- login_name: 4-20 chars, alphanumeric with ._
- public_username: 3-20 chars, alphanumeric with ._
- password: min 8 chars, 1 uppercase, 1 number, 1 special char
- email: valid email format (optional)
- budget: minimum 100
- gender: male, female, other
- partner_preference: male, female, any
- duration_preference: short_term_relationship, medium_term_relationship, long_term_relationship
- role: rs, srs
- currency: valid currency code

step.description: Registration step number. Must be 1 for initial validation or 2 for complete registration.

login_name.description: Unique identifier for login. 4-20 characters, alphanumeric with ._ allowed.

public_username.description: Display name visible to other users. 3-20 characters, alphanumeric with ._ allowed.

first_name.description: User's first name. Required for Step 2.

last_name.description: User's last name. Required for Step 2.

email.description: User's email address. Optional but recommended.

password.description: Account password. Minimum 8 characters, must contain 1 uppercase letter, 1 number, and 1 special character.

password_confirmation.description: Password confirmation. Must match the password field.

terms_accepted.description: Terms and conditions acceptance. Must be '1' to accept.

recaptcha.description: Google reCAPTCHA response token. Required for Step 1 and Step 2 unless is_mobile=Y.

recaptcha_session_id.description: Session ID from Step 1. Required for Step 2 unless is_mobile=Y.

is_mobile.description: Set to 'Y' for mobile registration to skip reCAPTCHA verification.

partner_preference.description: Preferred partner gender. Required for Step 2.

duration_preference.description: Preferred relationship duration. Optional for Step 2.

role.description: User's role in the platform. Required for Step 2.

budget.description: User's budget preference. Required for Step 2, minimum 100.

currency.description: User's preferred currency code. Required for Step 2.

timeoffset.description: User's timezone offset in minutes (JavaScript getTimezoneOffset() value). Optional.

timezone.description: User's timezone identifier (alternative to timeoffset). Optional.

affiliate_code.description: Referral code from another user. Optional.

get.description: Get your living profile information including transportation availability, living format preferences, and housing images.

Get your current profile visibility settings.

**Status of Registration**: Choose whether unregistered visitors can see your profile. Note that some registered users may use for their search another device whilst being not logged in. However, if the parameter is not set to registered users only, the photos will become publicly available the same way as they would in Instagram or other social networks.

**Financial Verification Status**: Financial verification means that a user stating certain monthly budget confirms his commitment by buying the annual subscription that costs multiple amounts of the monthly budget and confirms by that his financial soundness. Note that this does not amount to a full guarantee of the financial soundness. Even if you choose "All Users", only those having purchased Annual subscription would be able to contact you. This setting affects only the visibility to those without the Annual subscription. Your profile will not be seen even by those who have verified their monthly budget but set it lower than the budget set by SP.

**Mutual Interest Requirement**: Indicate whether there is a requirement that the user should be marked by you as interesting before they are able to see your profile. If this option is set, your profile will be invisible for everyone except those whose profiles were found by you on the Search Page and marked as Interesting.

financial_verification_status.description: Financial verification status - "verified" (Only Verified-Finance Users) or "all" (All Users)

mutual_interest_requirement.description: Mutual interest requirement - "all" (Any Visitors) or "marked" (Only marked by me)

get.description:
Returns a comprehensive list of all available custom parameter categories grouped by logical sections (General Info, Relationship and Availability, Financial Profile, Living Preferences). Each category contains fields with their types, options, and configurations that can be used for profile creation, editing, advanced search criteria, search templates, and custom matching algorithms.

## Field Types

- **dropdown**: Select from predefined options
- **currency**: Monetary value input that supports range filtering (min-max)
- **range_number**: Numeric range input (e.g., hours of availability)

## Currency Handling

- Uses the authenticated user's preferred currency from their financial profile
- Defaults to USD if no user currency is set
- Currency fields with `range: true` support minimum and maximum value filtering
- Currency values are automatically converted using real-time exchange rates for consistent comparisons during search

## Search Implementation

- All fields can be used with `scopeCustomSearch` method for filtering user profiles
- Range fields (`range_number`, `currency` with `range: true`) accept `valueRange` parameter with `min` and `max` values
- Dropdown fields accept single `value` parameter matching one of the predefined options
- Age, weight, and height use range-based filtering with hyphenated values (e.g., "25-33")

## Special Search Behaviors

- **Age**: Calculated dynamically from birth_date, not stored as a static value
- **Hobbies**: Uses relationship query to match user hobbies
- **Currency Fields**: Automatically converts between user currencies using exchange rates before comparison
- **Capital Growth Bonus**: Stored as percentage/ratio (no currency conversion applied)
- **Available Time Fields**: Support range filtering for morning, afternoon, and evening availability

## Use Cases

- Advanced search criteria to filter profiles
- Profile creation and editing
- Search templates for saved searches
- Custom matching algorithms
- Lifestyle, financial expectations, and relationship preference matching

post.description:
Search for user profiles with advanced filtering options. Supports location-based search, budget filtering, language matching, and custom parameter filtering.

## Key Features

**Role-based Filtering**: Results are automatically filtered based on user's role:
- "rs" (sponsor) users see only "srs" (seeker) profiles
- "srs" (seeker) users see only "rs" (sponsor) profiles

**Automatic Exclusions**: Excludes deleted users, current user, deleted profiles, and archived profiles

**Mutual Interest**: Respects visibility settings ("all" visible to everyone, "marked" only visible to marked users)

**Location Search**: Uses Haversine formula for distance calculations, supports multiple locations with different radii, defaults to user's location with 10km radius

**Monthly Budget**: Handles currency conversion automatically using latest exchange rates, considers user's minimum budget requirements

**Language Matching**: Considers fluency level with "any" (matches any language) or "all" (matches all languages) modes

**Custom Parameters**: Supports filtering by:
- **General Info**: age, weight, height, orientation, education_level, profession, religion, ethnicity, hobbies
- **Relationship & Availability**: relationship_goals, partner_preferences, duration_of_relationship, available_time_morning, available_time_afternoon, available_time_evening
- **Financial Profile**: capital_level_less_precise, capital_level_precise, monthly_income_less_precise, monthly_income_precise, one_time_payment_first_child, one_time_payment_second_child, one_time_payment_third_child, monthly_budget_per_child, financial_gift_upon_marriage, capital_growth_bonus, relationship_termination_compensation
- **Living Preferences**: driving_license_availability, car_availability, driver_availability, living_format_test_moon, living_format_preliminary_contract, living_format_final_contract

**Sorting Options**: Sort by monthly_budget (converted to search currency), age (birth date), or created_at (default)

**Subscription-based Filtering**: Sponsors without active subscriptions only see profiles that don't require financial verification

**Range-based Searches**: Age, weight, height use hyphenated format (e.g., "25-33"). Time availability and currency fields use value_range object with min/max properties (numeric). Currency fields should include filter_currency for cross-currency comparisons.

post.description:
Creates a new withdrawal transaction for the authenticated user. The system validates the user's available balance and processes the withdrawal request using the specified payment method and banking details.

## Authentication
- Requires authentication token in the request header
- Token must be obtained through login

## Withdrawal Methods

| Method | Type | Description | Required Fields |
|--------|------|-------------|-----------------|
| `SWIFT` | Bank Transfer | International bank transfer via SWIFT | bank_name, bank_swift_code, bank_account_number, bank_receiver_name |
| `SEPA` | Bank Transfer | European bank transfer via SEPA | bank_name, bank_swift_code, bank_account_number, bank_receiver_name |
| `USDT` | Cryptocurrency | USDT withdrawal to wallet | wallet_address |
| `BTC` | Cryptocurrency | Bitcoin withdrawal to wallet | wallet_address |

## Validation Rules
- **Amount**: Must be numeric and greater than or equal to 0
- **Method**: Must be one of the valid withdrawal methods
- **Currency**: Required field
- **Bank Details**: Required only for SWIFT and SEPA methods
- **Wallet Address**: Required only for USDT and BTC methods

## Balance Requirements
- Withdrawals can only use **available balance** (active_balance + affiliate_earning_balance)
- The system checks available balance before processing the withdrawal
- Pending or locked balances cannot be withdrawn

## Transaction Processing
1. **Validation**: All required fields are validated based on the selected method
2. **Balance Check**: System verifies sufficient available balance
3. **Transaction Creation**: A new withdrawal transaction is created with status 'pending'
4. **Banking Details**: Withdrawal-specific banking information is stored
5. **Response**: Transaction details are returned for tracking

## Banking Information Storage

The system stores the following withdrawal-specific information:
- `withdrawal_bank_name` - Bank name for bank transfers
- `withdrawal_bank_swift_code` - SWIFT code for bank transfers
- `withdrawal_bank_account_number` - Account number for bank transfers
- `withdrawal_bank_receiver_name` - Account holder name for bank transfers
- `withdrawal_wallet_address` - Wallet address for cryptocurrency withdrawals

## Notes
- Withdrawal transactions are created with 'pending' status and require manual processing
- All withdrawal attempts are logged for audit purposes
- Banking details are securely stored for processing
- Users can track withdrawal status through the `/transactions` endpoint
- Withdrawal processing times vary by method (bank transfers typically take 1-3 business days)

## Related Endpoints
- `GET /transactions` - View transaction history including withdrawals
- `GET /balance` - Check current available balance
- `GET /payment-methods?type=withdrawal` - Get available withdrawal methods

- Requires authentication token in the request header

- `pending` - Transaction is pending processing
- `completed` - Transaction has been completed successfully
- `failed` - Transaction has failed
- `cancelled` - Transaction has been cancelled

#### Available Transaction Types
- `deposit` - Money deposit to user account
- `subscription` - Subscription purchase
- `budget_upgrade` - Budget upgrade payment
- `withdrawal` - Money withdrawal from user account

get.description:
Retrieves available subscription plans with pricing calculated based on the user's monthly lifestyle support budget.

#### Authentication
- Requires authentication token in the request header
- Token must be obtained through login

#### Budget Calculation Logic
- **User's Budget**: Uses the user's current lifestyle support budget or active subscription monthly budget
- **Partner's Budget**: **DISABLED** - Partner budget functionality is currently disabled in the system
- **Currency Conversion**: Automatic currency conversion is available for multi-currency support
- **Fallback**: System uses user's budget for all calculations

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Currency code for pricing (defaults to user's preferred currency)

parameters.name: upgrade
parameters.description: Set to 'yes' to show only plans higher than current plan level

parameters.name: budget_user_id
parameters.description: **DISABLED** - Partner's user ID functionality is currently disabled

get.description:
Calculate the additional payment required when upgrading monthly budget for users with active subscriptions. If `amount` parameter is provided, calculates upgrade cost from current budget to the new amount. If no `amount` parameter is provided, uses the `pending_lifestyle_support_budget` from user's financial profile.

#### Important Notes
- Only works for users with active subscriptions
- Returns error if user has no active subscription
- Returns error if upgrade amount is less than or equal to current budget
- Returns error if no pending budget exists (when amount not provided)
- The `pricing_calculation_details` array provides step-by-step calculation for UI display

#### Authentication
- Requires authentication token in the request header
- Token must be obtained through login

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The new budget amount for upgrade calculation (optional). If not provided, uses pending_lifestyle_support_budget from financial profile.

200.description: Success response with budget upgrade information

value.message: You don't have any pending budget upgrade.
You are not subscribed to any plan.
The difference between the pending budget and the active subscription monthly budget is 0.
